Hebrews


                              Chapter 1 

     3 (Colossians 1:15;  2:9; Colossians 3:10; see EGW on John 1:14; Acts 1:11;  17:28; Ephesians 1:20, 21; Hebrews 2:14-18). The Personality of God.--He [Christ] represented God not as an essence that pervaded nature, but as a God who has a personality. Christ was the express image of His Father's person; and He came to our world to restore in man God's moral image, in order that man, although fallen, might through obedience to God's commandments become enstamped with the divine image and character--adorned with the beauty of divine loveliness (MS 24, 1891).
